Can I Join?

We welcome anyone to our events from the WLINTA* and Queer community that does not identify as a cis-hetero man.

We respect, celebrate and explore the variety of gender, sexual expressions and identifications. We strive for A body-positive and open space based on collaboration, informed consent and respectful communication.

We understand that all bodies are inherently political. Political in the way that any set of actions aimed at either maintaining or changing a given power relationship/structure will inherently be political. We do not live or work in a bubble. We believe that our existence is linked to the current power structures that exist in the world we inhabit.

We believe that the current power structures mostly manifest as a difference in access to resources for different kinds of people. We therefore concentrate our attention mostly on the bodies and people that are not favored by the current system but are policed, rendered invisible, regarded as undesired or even dangerous including whose demographic are also a part of: LGBTQIA+, BiPOC and womÃªn. We are continuously working on our accountability processes and invite you to join us in this.
